Reviews.Title: “A contemporary hotel close to the best Berlin shops”
Reviews.Author: N G
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with good staff who are happy to adapt to requirements. My only issue is that what they call a hotel suite, I call a large hotel room (not a suite). My room was clean, bright, airy and well appointed and when I return to Berlin I will return to the Hotel Ellington.

Reviews.Title: “short break in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just two nights. Wonderful hotel serving extensive buffett breakfast. Extremely clean rooms and lovely bar with excellent bar food. Also has an elegant restaurant which we did not use. The staff here are so helpful and we do not hesitate to recommend it. Best break ever only wish it were for longer.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel average staff”
Reviews.Author: alex h
Reviews.Content: the hotel was in a great location with easy access to metro. Rooms were modern (strangely set out) the hotel is completly white. We didnt fancy the restaurant to much looked a bit fancy and pricey. Hotel was very clean. The staff i found were a little rude, they didnt ask how our trip was or told us to enjoy the stay. I didnt feel like i could ask them much about the city etc. However I found this was the case with most of the germans I came into contact with.

Reviews.Title: “Hospital!!!”
Reviews.Author: KorinoKorino
Reviews.Content: The hotel is like a hospital, the room was like a hospital room, depressing. Do not expect to find the rooms that are showed in the pictures!!! my room was so small, the windows are looking to the trash area and car parking lot. The girl at the reception told me that ' you have a backyard viewwww!!!' I was expecting something greenery :( it was really the most terrible hotel experience ever. The stuff in general are not smiling and are not helpful. The bathroom is inside the room ( I mean in the middle of it without a door :) and so dont invite or plan to stay with a friend unless you are planing to take a shower together . There was no wardrobe in my room !! only 3 hangers over the minibar !! By the way if your luggage is heavy be sure you can carry it on the stairs. Since the elevator can stop a different level from your room floor level . There are rooms at a half level up or down. Of course no one at reception can tell to you!! I am really sad and upset about the price that I had to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: strawberrycheesecake
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with this hotel. Great location, very near to both U Bahn and S Bahn (5-10 minute walk). Hotel is very modern, clean and staff are very friendly. The rooms have a quirky design and beds are very comfortable. You are able to store your luggage on the last day free of charge, which is very handy. We stayed in this hotel over the Christmas market period, and found the location perfect for exploring the Christmas markets, as two of the markets are under 5 minute walk away and all the others can be reached from the U or S Bahn. The hotel is just around the corner for KaDeWe- which you could spend a whole day in to be honest! It took us about an hour and a half to reach the hotel via the U and S Bahn from the airport (but it didn't take us long to get used to the trains), so it only took us 40 minutes on the way back to the airport. If you want a modern, clean and friendly hotel with everything you need for a great city break, situated in a great area, very neat to transport links, then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Freya12
Reviews.Content: The Ellington Hotel is in a perfect location for a site-seeing trip or a shopping trip to Berlin. The architecture is interesting and the hotel is clean with very efficient service. The breakfast is expensive at 20 Euros per person but 'My Cafe' opposite the hotel does a wonderful breakfast for much less, with very friendly staff. The model railway shop, also opposite the hotel, is well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky”
Reviews.Author: Annoymous25
Reviews.Content: Booked the Ellington as a birthday surprise for my boyfriend and was not disappointed. We are a couple in our early thirties and the reviews, price and location was the main reason why I chose the Ellington . On arrival we decided to ask for an upgrade from a standard room to a superior in which we were successful. The hotel was a previous taxation office so the corridors are rather long and clinical looking but not a problem. The room was spacious and clean with large windows giving views out onto the road. Some might find the arrangement of the room odd but we like the minimalist look so it suited us. There were plenty of towels, a safe, hair dryer and a mini bar which for a hotel wasn't to highly priced as others I have stayed. Considering the weather was bitterly cold it was a welcome relief to come back to a heated room. Be aware that check in is after 3pm and check out is midday but they can store your luggage for free which was excellent considering we had an evening flight. We didn't bother with breakfast as it would have been an additional charge and I think they told us 18 euros per person which I think is rather steep and there are plenty of coffee houses around the corner so we ate out each morning at half the price! The hotel is in a brilliant location only a five minute walk to the underground come out of the hotel and turn right and right again and you can't miss it. The area is full of excellent shops, restaurants and bars with a really good vibe so you really are in the heart of the action but without too much hustle and bustle. The reception staff were also very friendly and helpful in assisting us with the local transport and general points of history. I was not aware that most of the big museums close on a Monday and that Sundays are very quiet with most shops closed for the day so plan carefully what you want to do or could get caught out if only here for a couple of nights. One point to mention we did go to visit the Cupola but unfortunately you must reserve beforehand at least a month otherwise you might be disappointed. Overall we had a fantastic break and would certainly recommend staying at the Ellington and visiting again, thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Mickgas
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two weeks for work which they were quite aware of but they put me over the bar and next to a function room. Noise at all times of the day and night. When I asked to change rooms they would not oblige. They also had a computer "glitch" that managed to charge my bank account 670 euros for charges that I didn't incur. The charges were taken out every night at 3am. Hmmmmm. When I went to the front desk they were in no way helpful and said it wasn't theyre fault. After countless phone calls to the hotel the manager was finally able to sort it out , but it took two weeks to get the refund

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Modern Hotel! Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: craigcamop
Reviews.Content: Just had a little break in Berlin and stayed here. Great location. Comfy rooms. Excellent service. Tasty cocktails! Fabuloys hotel with everything you need. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but they're a little "stingy"..... :(”
Reviews.Author: donbacardi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the New Year's Eve celebration (2011-2012). Booked for four days. Great location near the shopping district area (Kufferstdam). Easy access to S-Bahn and U-Bahn, Buses and Taxi's all at walking district. I label this hotel stingy for two reasons: internet access is not FREE !! Most hotels that I've been to in Europe provide this free of charge. This hotel is considered a four star hotel. Two: parking space behind hotel available but they charge 18 euros a day ! I can deal with these two shortcomings. Hope to return again someday. Big Plus: the morning brunch is excellant ! :))

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Just Dont Access the Internet.”
Reviews.Author: anataman
Reviews.Content: We stayed her as a family and loved the location close to shops and a Christmas market as well as being only a short walk to the Zoogarten train station. We had a large 'L' shaped family room with the children in bunk beds at one end, and the parents in two single beds pushed together at the other. It was great that a hotel thought of families staying and had even included some toys in the room. The only disadvantage was that the shower opens directly into the bedroom, so no privacy if you take a shower, also no iron in the room if you want to press your clothes. We were attending a party so we could hardly complain about the loud music coming from the function room above, but if you do take a family room ensure that there aren't any evening events happening, or you'll be taking part whether you like it or not. Skip the hotel breakfast buffet and walk around the corner the superb bakeries where a family of 4 can eat their fill of patisseries,tea, coffee and juice for less than the price of a single place in the buffet. We had a mix up at checkout where we were not charged the rate that had been quoted to us at booking, probably due to miscommunication, but then again our confirmation email hadn't included any price. Happily this was quickly sorted to our satisfaction, but this might have been avoided with more transparent pricing, which brings me to the internet fees. The hotel charges an unbelievable EUR 24 per day wifi usage, as much as most residential connections cost per month. At that price I would expect my requested web pages brought to me by a butler on a silver tray, not a standard net connection. Equally, the internet access page should have a flashing red warning message informing users of the charges, not hide them away in small print where they can be easily overlooked, especially if you don't read German. At checkout we were able to negotiate the fees down to a more reasonable hourly charge, but I did wish that I'd paid more attention when the inevitable “Dad, can we use the internet?” request was raised. The hotel building is lovely, our room was well designed, and although our issues were quickly resolved I can't help but feel with better communication such issues shouldn't have occurred in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, 'economical' rooms”
Reviews.Author: ubgqv83
Reviews.Content: I agree in part with the previous author. The major areas where this hotel falls down are in the size of the rooms (however this is evident when viewing the online pictures) and the lack of free internet - this should be a given in an decent hotel these days. However, the staff were fantastic, the bar in great, the rooms are quiet and the price is also very good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city as you aren't going to be cooped up in your hotel room for any great period of time anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely interior design & bar & great location”
Reviews.Author: BecciLeeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend for 3 nights & really enjoyed our stay. The location is just off the main shopping street in West Berlin & a very short walk from 2 U-Bahn stations, the closest is Ausberger but Wittenbergplatz is only a couple of minutes walk away too & it is easier to get to other main lines from here. The hotel is very large & the interior design is clean, modern & minimalist. We had a decent sized room (282), however our 'double bed' was actually 2 twins pushed together & with 2 single duvets?! Very soft pillows. Nice & clean room though with the 'exposed' bathroom means that the shower steps straight out into the room but we didn't mind this. Our view was of the carpark behind the hotel & also into the windows of a department store so had to keep curtains closed when dressing! The room was quite chilly & the air con heating didn't warm the room up much so take pyjamas if you're chilly at night. We didn't eat in the hotel, but they told us breakfast was 19 euros each. So we ate at a lovely place called 'My Cafe' right across from the hotel which is very nice. There are also a few restaurants & bars on the hotel street, but generally we travelled into the East of the city to eat & sightsee as a lot more interesting sights & cheaper food. The hotel bar is very stylish with lots of sofas & a jazz theme & even it's own jazz radi station & you can see the dj in a radio booth. Staff were helpful & check out is 12pm & they will store your luggage for free if your flight is later on which we found very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, nice bar, Good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: drBuhi
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not too big, but the hotel experience is good. The bar is really a must and you should have enough time for the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Chic Property”
Reviews.Author: andrew166
Reviews.Content: The Ellington is a very cool, chic property located in the centre of the western neighborhood of Berlin. It is close to many restaurants bars and Berlin's biggest shopping street. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I think anyone that stays here will enjoy it. The rooms are a little bit tiny but with high ceilings and big windows providing a considerable amount of light. Room design is a bit unusual, but once you get used to it seems to work. The bar and restaurant areas are attractive and the food is very good. They have live bands and DJs on the weekends. Overall- I had a great time, felt welcome and am very glad that I picked this hotel for my visit to Berlin. While I would not recommend this place to families with young children, older couples, light sleepers or people who just want somewhere out of the way and quiet - if you want a cool place to chill by day before sightseeing and then relax in at night, this is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Small clean modern rooms central location great shopping.”
Reviews.Author: ezra1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently rooms are small but very clean and modern. Great location reasonably priced drinks in the bar. Ideal location for seeing everything. Buy the Berlin card for using public transport it's great and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel w/mostly small rooms”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: I have to admit i like this hotel. I like the decor and its bauhaus style. Most of the rooms are rather small so I tend to ask for an upgrade to a deluxe room and then you have a very nice size room. In these rooms the shower is in the "middle" of the hotel room so that can be fun. Its a big hotel so if ur unlucky u might end up walking over 3 minutes to your room from the elevator. Breakfast is perfect. The hotel is named after Duke Ellington and also has a Jazz radio station studio in the lobby area

Reviews.Title: “Very bright and funky rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mario P
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited Berlin in mid September 2011. The hotel was perfect in location for our needs, busy shopping area, although the age group around in the day time was very old and lots of tourist buses, none the less, the hotel was wonderful. The room was very modern, a good size with great sunlight brightening up the room. the bathroom was in a unique position with no wall from the bathtub/shower into the bedroom and the windows which faced the apartments across, although they were far enough, it did feel strange having a shower and being able to see people on their balconies, but this was still a great feature. The service level was interesting, as to get to your room you do not pass the front desk or any staff the service is indeed discreet and they almost leave you to your own devices, almost to not disturb you, which was a great thing. The rest of the hotel had wonderful old design, with some amazing very art deco tiles, with different colours on each floor, loved it. the eating and drinking establishments looked awesome, but we never got to try them out.

Reviews.Title: “happy choice”
Reviews.Author: JudithHughes53
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ellington because of its Bauhaus design and could not have been happier. The room is different but excellent, the breakfast room funky and contemporary as are the staff. The restaurant Duke's was sensational. We would have eaten there every night but felt we should be more adventurous. Relaxing in the cocktail bar at the end of the day was something we looked forward to as we walked our legs off in fascinating Berlin. All this and a history which includes German cabaret in the 30s and the likes of Ella Fitzgerald, Louis Armstrong and of course, Duke Ellington, in more recent times. Highly recommended. Judith

Reviews.Title: “Nice design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanita_Latvia_Riga
Reviews.Content: In very central location. With private car parking. It has been a hospital or smth. Friendly staff. Very clean. Toilet is separate, but shower and sink is in the room, though inside of the shower can not be seen from the bed - it could be embarassing. There is no bide or sink in the toilet room, so that can be embarassing and not convenient, too. We loved the design of the hotel. We had a quiet room overlooking back side of the hotel - multistorey car park. Comfortable bed (2 beds pushed together in a double room). Good value for the price we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - rest average”
Reviews.Author: Hanseat
Reviews.Content: I give seminars and my client recently booked this hotel for us. Here is my impression on the various parts of the hotel: 1. Meeting facitlities: Excellent staff, very attentive - top rate 2. Hotel rooms: strange, the shower was in the middle of the room and considering the curtains didn't close properly, it was a bit awkward. If you get a room facing the road you will be awakened early as the sun comes straight into the room/or is reflected. Whatever, it makes it difficult to have a good nights rest. Rooms facing the courtyard are also a problem as there is a bar there where people sit out in the evenings. It can be very loud. 3. Food: probably the most dissapointing part of the experience. Breakfast is fine, lunch and dinner buffets are ok. If however you are on a conference package (which we were) the Duke restaurant offers very average food dressed up in fancy names. There are tons and tons of good restaurants in the side streets, it makes real sense to go discovering them.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel, but be forewarned”
Reviews.Author: Genisisguy2011
Reviews.Content: I was a member of a group tour that stayed at the Ellington Hotel for 5 nights, during June, 2011. Being a single person, I was allocated what the hotel designates as its "standard" room. Upon entering the room I was shocked at how small it was, even by European standards. It was, literally, impossible to open my luggage, other than placing the bag on the bed, as there wasn't enough space in the room. To describe the room, the word "shoebox" seems appropriate. When I was unsuccessful in convincing the front desk staff to give me a larger room, the tour director spoke to them, in German, and I was given a larger room, with much more space, and comfort. So be forewarned if you are a single traveler. I only had the buffet breakfast at the hotel, each day during my stay, and the variety of food offered was very good. A nice feature was the omelette/egg station available for guests to order their selection, and have it cooked. An advantage of the hotel's location is the short 5 minute walk to the upscale Ka De We, multi-story, department store, considered by many to be Berlin's premier shopping destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, nice Bar”
Reviews.Author: Franz11111
Reviews.Content: The Ellington is very central in Berlin. It's close to the underground station and there are many shopping possibilitys like the KaDeWe arround. The rooms are very nice and clean. If you go there, also try the Cocktails from the Hotel Bar.

Reviews.Title: “If we visit Berlin again, we will stay here.”
Reviews.Author: LeedsRupert
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stylish and unusual. The service is good, staff speak excellent English and are helpful. The hotel is clean and the rooms, although smallish, are comfortable and have everything you need for a short city break. Breakfast is great and good value. Location is good for shopping and zoo with U-bahn and bus stops a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric hotel, top quality service”
Reviews.Author: Jorganmeister
Reviews.Content: Apparently a former Eastern German state taxation office, now a vast hotel. If you only visited the bar and/or restaurant you'd assume the place was comparable to the best London 5 star hotels - very stylish and excellent personal service. Nice food too. Upstairs, the building's history is more apparent. Rooms are small and strangely designed as a result, to fit bathrooms in. The toilet is in its own room (cupboard) and the shower and basin are in the centre of the room with no privacy from any other occupants of the room, so if you are sharing, go with someone you know well. If this isn't an issue for you then it's well worth a stay, particularly at sub-100 euro prices.

Reviews.Title: “expectation gap”
Reviews.Author: g-drako
Reviews.Content: interesting and tasteful design in the public areas. poor-empty corridors and very small (standard) rooms with very small beds, no doulbes available on standard rooms. breakfast area uncomfortable (most seats at benches which is maybe nice if you want to socialize, but definetely very bad for the back). At 7,30am housekeeping knocks your door, so do not forget to hang the Do not disturb. Do not trust reception if you want to book a taxi, better do it yourself. The cigar lounge is also general smoking lounge, which kills the cigar experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but rooms need some 'refreshment'”
Reviews.Author: AngkorGems
Reviews.Content: This place is stylish, but the rooms are small although we had a so called superior room. The carpet was not the cleanest one, the walls in the room were calling for a fresh paint. Ask the reception for a written essay to the history of the building - is fun. The breakfast buffet gets 4 stars ! xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not so the room.”
Reviews.Author: niro12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the canter of town near KA.DE.WE shopping center. The hotel is clean with good breakfast. The only downsize is the room which at basic are small with transparency shower right next to bed. Thing that can be quit awkward with you travel with partner or friend.

Reviews.Title: “Overly expensive rooms plus plus plus!”
Reviews.Author: funfunfuntimes
Reviews.Content: Overly expensive room for mere basics. No jug or tea and coffee in rooms. No free WIFI anywhere. You pay 24euros/day if you want internet. You need a cable to connect in your room, unless you want to sit in the sterile lobby where there is wireless. Rooms are very odd design where you can't open two doors at the same time without obstructing one doorway. I attended a convention, and no water was on the tables for the 12 hours of lectures we sat through for 3 days. Breakfast was another 19 euros each day, and lunches at the hotel could easily be over 30 euros. Good food but expensive for Berlin. Cafe across the road will feed you breakfast for around 5 euros. Location was great if you like shopping! Close to two train stations as well, and easy walking distance to the zoo. Staff were not overly helpful, but always kept very busy at the front desk. It's a massive hotel. Nothing impressive about this hotel except for that it has the space to cater for several hundred delegates for a big convention. It's built for business people.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel - spartan”
Reviews.Author: scbaker
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel - an old building that was recently renovated. It was clean and the staff were friendly, but it's just not my taste. The spartan decor of the room left me cold. Also, the bed was two little twin beds pushed together to make a normal size bed - not my favorite configuration. Blocking out light in the morning is an issue as the room had massive windows with a series of "not quite overlapping" curtains. If you like modern and funky, this hotel could be for you. Just know what you're getting. Oh, yeah - internet is really pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: travellingtrent
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ellington is located in a great neighborhood in Berlin close to shops, public transport, the main park, one of the gay neigbhorhoods, and historic sites of interest. It is a great place to stay as a vacation or business traveller. I was in Berlin for work and stayed two days afterward and found this to be a lovely hotel with large rooms, a nice bathroom (hard to find in Europe at this price), great breakfast, a quiet setting, and lovely staff. It was one of the best Europen hotel experiences within this price range I´ve had. If you are a big bed linen and towel afficiando, this might not be the place for you but other than that it was a wonderful experience. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, OK location”
Reviews.Author: ziggy1960
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice; the rooms are very minimalist, but nice. Very comfy beds! Older hotel, but kept up very well. Excellent breakfast buffet. Most of the staff were very helpful. There is not a lot in the way of restaurants nearby; but about 3 blocks away there are many things.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalism pushed to the edge!”
Reviews.Author: eye7eye
Reviews.Content: Reception: Fast and efficient Rooms: Very minimalist, dont expect luxuries like a soap bar, hair shampoo or hand lotion, these rooms a clean and simple with soap dispenser in shower. If you like the condition of your hair, take your own shampoo! Bed is comfy and pillows nice. There is 3 sliding curtains that cant block out sun, so if you like to sleep in a little late, take an eye mask, especially in summer when the sun rises at 6am! Gym/Fitness: Basic, treadmill, 2 cycles and a walker type thing, only one TechnoGym machine for pecs! Just one ball, and a few dumbbells (max 10kg's), not ideal for working out, but at least there is something. very clean, free water and tv screens on machines. What I like: Awesome breakfast (especially if they serve outside in the courtyard) What I didn't like: The rate for internet is Euro 3 per hour! (yes insane!), the curtains cant close properly so you are awake at 6am with the bright sun entering the room

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced and painfully trendy”
Reviews.Author: Carlos_Barcelona
Reviews.Content: Ellington hotel wants to be a design hotel, minimalist decor, fashion and what they self call “Trendy & Elegant hotel”. After 2 days there on occasion of a business meeting held in the hotel, here is my opinion. The lack of security in the hotel is evident. You can easily access the rooms from the road without any control of the hotel staff. When I accessed my room at midnight upon arrival, my room was really cold. Heating system did not do much to revert the situation, and one expects that in a German hotel, where cold is present most of the year, heating systems are way more efficient. My room was simply what I do not want of a hotel room, complicated, improperly designed and thought. Details: there is not a power supply outlet in the working desk nor close to the room table, for internet access, hotel charges the outrageous rate of 3€ per hour, regardless of the time you have been logged on, that is if you are 1 minute you are still charged 3€, a maximum of “only” 24€ per day I was told in case you inadvertedly forgot to log out. My hotel rate was 160€/night, without breakfast and without internet access. For such a 4 star hotel, I feel totally ripped off. Breakfast was 19€ “only” and can’t judge the quality as I went to a café in front and got an excellent croissant and cappuccino which for me is more than enough to start the day. All in all paying such amount of money per night should give you much more comfort and sensation of luxury, other than design. I stayed in room 135, it was located in the 1st floor, sound insulation from nearby street was weak and more important, light insulation was a disaster as curtains, which by the way are a real pain to deploy, provide not enough darkness and it is not nice to hear cars and feel the incoming daylight at roughly 5 am. Besides, if for whatever reason you are in a double occupancy basis (not necessarily being a couple), prepare to shower in an “open” area, as bathroom and shower is integrated in the room. Toilette is separated though. To summarize, I have stayed in far better hotels in Berlin. If you are ready to pay such amount of money, go somewhere else where you get better value for your money. I travel extensively worldwide and fortunately, I have learned to recognize the type of hotels where everything has a cost and additional income from guests is a must. I try more and more to avoid these hotels type. Hotel staff was nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Bright, clean and elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: dublin_boy
Reviews.Content: Spent only 1 night here but would been happy to have stayed longer! As others have pointed out the rooms are relatively small, and ours at least had a curious shower/washbaisin in the room arrangement which may be little too intimate for some people. However the light decor and high ceilings made it feel quite spacious. The location is great, close to the main shops but still peaceful. Staff were all helpful, the WiFi fast and there is a funky coin-operated PC and printer booth in the lobby if you need to print boarding passes, etc. The highlight for us was the stunning courtyard with restaurant and bar. With tasteful furniture, soft lighting and relaxing music from the in-house radio station, it is the perfect place to have a drink on a balmy summer's evening.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb! A little piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: sunnycy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked for me by my German colleagues and I was slightly apprehensive. But as soon as I walked in, I fell in love with this beautiful art deco building which has been amazingly renovated paying special attention to detail. The hotel and the room were a little piece of heaven after a long freezing day working in Berlin. The hotel is centrally located, so you could walk everywhere but is also close to major transport nodes. The staff is very friendly, all speak perfect English and nothing was too much trouble. The room must be one of the best arranged hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. German efficiency and style at its best! Minimal yet not pretentious, clean, comfy beds and extremely functional. I would have liked a bit more space for my suitcase and for hanging shirts etc. Coffee making facilities in the room would have been an added bonus but since the bar/lounge area was so beautiful I didnt mind spending time there. The hot power shower was a fantastic end to a cold day. The breakfast was superb! The restaurant was very good but I enjoyed the bar more, especially the drinks and the funky jazz music. The bar also seemed to attract hip but easy going people. I simply can’t praise this hotel highly enough, the staff and their service were exceptional. Definitely going back and recommending it to others!!

Reviews.Title: “Non-Smoking Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: YellowCrazyFish
Reviews.Content: I cannot complain at all. Our room was small - but nice and clean. Modern bathroom and comfy beds, facing the street with double glazed windows - no street noise. Breakfast had a good choice. The location was ver convenient, just around the corner of KaDeWe and many restaurants, only 10- 15 minutes drive to the Exhibition centre and 20min to Tegel Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist chic”
Reviews.Author: FayetteBolton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for a winter city break. Excellent central location near the U-Bahn and great welcome experienced. The reception were friendly and helpful: nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were as promised: minimal, clean but functional: what more could you want? The shower was very powerful, the bed comfy and the towels soft. The only downside was that there were no tea and coffee making facilities that would have gone down a treat on the cold, wintery days in November. Room 182 unfortunately looked on on to the rubbish skips and storgae area for the neighbouring florists, so noise woke us from our slumber: this disturbance was not too early though. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Berlin without staying here, then you will have missed out”
Reviews.Author: smileyboo12
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend and it was made special from the minute we walked in the hotel. The reception staff were lovely and gave us all sorts of information about where to go etc. AND they gave us the best map - the 'hotel map' went everywhere with us!! The location was spot on and the only time we went on public transport was on our way back to the airport - we walked everywhere else! The whisky sour the barman prepared was the best ever and we just couldnt resist trying the food whilst we sat there - the oriental platter went brilliantly with the cocktails! The rooms were bright and minimalist - but we wanted for nothing, with a well stocked mini bar, strong power shower and loads of wardrobe and storage space. When we go back to Berlin, we won't even try to find a different hotel. In fact, the Ellington is probably one of the reasons we would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edLondonUK
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed here July 2009 and were very impressed with the rooms, cleanliness and reception staff. The rooms are white and pale cream colour and very bright and spacious (rooms at the rear of the building were smaller). we usually stay at 4 or 5 star hotels and both of was would be more than happy if all hotel rooms were to this standard. The beds were so comfortable I actually looked forward to getting in it! The shower was in the actual room although not facing the bed and it would be easy to cover up with a towel before stepping out of the shower (toilet is seperate). Interestingly this huge art deco building was originally a very important financial office block. There is a good quality Spanish/Italian restaurant 2 minutes to the left hand side of the hotel and the underground within 4/5 mins. Europes largest department store Ka De We is with 3 mins away. We did the 3rd Riech 4 hour walking tour which is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but too minimalist”
Reviews.Author: madcow1976
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was located just off Ku'damm, so very convenient for transport, as well as the Zoo, etc. However, the accommodation was lacking in many areas. Our room was comfortable, the bed especially, and we knew from other reviews that the shower cubicle faced into the room, which was strange but not too much of a problem. The main problem with our room was storage. The only place to put your clothes was a rail with about 6 hangers on it. There were no drawers or shelves whatsoever to put the rest of our clothes in, so we had to practically live from our suitcase with crumpled clothes! Also, there was nowhere to hang towels apart from a small hand towel rail under the sink, meaning bath towels had to be hung over the shower door. The sink had no shelves for your toiletries, and nowhere to put your soap. They supplied a tiny hand soap which was useless. We bought our own liquid soap from a local chemist. I also had to buy a travel kettle while we were there as there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. When we asked at reception for a kettle they said they didn't provide them, but they would bring us hot water if we phoned them from our room!! I would also add that having white carpets in the rooms is very impractical, as it was covered in stains, and showed up the slightest bit of dirt from your shoes etc. If the storage issues with the rooms were resolved, we might stay here again, but I think we will look for another hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away, Far Away”
Reviews.Author: deutscheAi
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by the rudest reception ever. I travel a lot and have never experienced such snobby reception. Maybe it was just one of those being in the wrong place at the wrong time situations, but I'm a paying guest and I don't expect to be handled like a street beggar! Going to your room is a long (long) white hallway, and the room numbers are written on the floor in the carpet. it feels like you've just checked in to a mental asylum. Now I've never checked in to a mental asylum, but now I know what it feels like. The hotel has a creepiness about it. The hotel is a postmodern/minimalist theme, if you like ipod and the color white, this might be just your thing. At first glance it looks calming and nice. But there are a lot of details that have just been overlooked. It's too easy to just paint everything white and call yourself a design hotel!!! The biggest shock was probably the youth hostel style room...The shower is integrated into the room, so when you get out of the shower, expect to be standing naked in front on the bed. Def for friends travelling together, be prepared for some up close encounters!! :) They could have just installed a (portable) wall or sth cheap to separate the sleeping area from the shower. But instead you wake up staring at the sink and towels...youth hostel style. To top it off they didn't consider that wet towels need to be hung amd dried at some point and the nearest wall knobs are near the entrance door. So if you're staying a few nites, and forget that you left your towel to dry on the second day, expect to walk wet from the shower to the door. Another thing that really annoys me (when I pay so much for a room) is the communal shampoo and body wash. the gigantic plastic bottle stuck to the wall upside down for every guest to use (oh how convenient for hair and body!). I'm not nit picky but this is 2* standards. And the question of sanitaryness is always lingering in the back of my head. Speaking of which, they thought enough to give you a free mini soap for the sink, but left no soap dish (i guess they were really following the 'minimalist' theme) so the soap just slides all over the place. There are no convenient shelfs to put your toiletry kit, so basically I left it on the sink where the soap proceeded to make a sticky mess out of the exterior of my toiletry kit. if you use the toilet, located at the entrance of the room, you have to walk around to the shower area to wash you hands. So it seems ironic to me that everything is white in this hotel, whereas hygienical standards have been thrown out the window. The staff is a horror. Not just the useless and rude reception but also the staff in the breakfast hall, yes I was stupid enough to pay 17Euros for breakfast, (the offering was good) but the staff were useless. you have to get your own coffee, or hunt down a carafe. there are plenty of staff but none that pick up dirty plates. They walked by multiple times and just ignored the stack of dirty dishes left from the guests sitting there prior to me, and one or two from my cereal. I didn't dare to ask them to clean it up, for they might have either bitten my head off or kicked me out of the hotel for speaking up! I'm not one to be intimidated by people but the staff here just carries this arrogance about them. I've been to multiple hotels, some cheaper, some more expensive, but this is by far the worst value for money I've ever experienced. stay away from the ellington!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PMaloney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August 2008. Reception: Staff were excellent. If you need any information on Berlin just ask them (as we did on numerous occasions). Room: It was spotless. The only point to note was the location of the shower. It is a cubical next to the bed so if you are sharing with friends, you will not have any privacy. The beds are twin beds also. Restaurant: We just had breakfast in the hotel. There was a wide range of fresh fruits, breads, fried food etc. Amenities: There is a fitness centre in the hotel but we did not use it. Getting there: We took a taxi from the airport, the duration was approx 15 minutes and cost 20 Euro. Location: The hotel is perfectly located for tourists. It is one block away from the underground station (choose No.2 to Pankow) which will bring you directly to some of the main attractions like Checkpoint Charlie and the Sony centre etc. The circle tour bus will take you to all main attractions in the city (you can buy tickets at reception) and it also stops just one block away from the hotel. The zoo is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. It is worth buying a 24/48/72 hour "Berlin Card" as you will get discounts at most of the main attractions and it also can be used on the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Goldspink
Reviews.Content: We didn't pay for the stay ourselves so value for money is difficult to judge. We did, however, have a great time. The rooms were very nice and very clean. Housekeeping were very friendly and professional. Reception staff were very welcoming and knowledgeable when we asked for recommendations. When the weather was bad you could borrow an umbrella, for which you needed a deposit. But as they do want them back I understand it. The breakfast was a big plus! Very good, wide range, always enough. The hotel bar was slightly impersonal but they had a nice and wide variety of cocktails. The only real criticism I had after a very pleasant stay is the shower, which is not in a seperate bathroom. We shared a twin room which didn't give us much privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Not so impressed with the Ellington”
Reviews.Author: Puppy68
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately really disappointed with this hotel. On the plus side it is very centrally located and most major sights are easily accessible by public transport. There is also excellent shopping in the area. Although the Ellington looks great and the staff were friendly and helpful I don't know if I would stay here again, especially for the price. Given the number of problems we had I think the Ellington represents poor value for money and the breakfast is not included in the room rate and costs €15. I know some hotels do charge separately for breakfast, but given the hotel's rates and their classification of four stars, I think this is pretty poor. The layout of the bathroom area is awkward and didn't allow for any privacy. Fine if you are staying as a couple or don't mind being naked in front of your room mate, but pretty embarassing otherwise. Also, all rooms are twin beds with separate linen. This was very uncomfortable as a couple. We had also booked a double only to find that they had booked us a single initially and this had to be corrected. Upon providing a credit card as security on arrival as usual practice, the hotel then proceeded to block the amount for our stay plus an additional €50 for every day we were staying there, for expenses apparently, on the card. This was close to €1,000. I have never experienced this practice anywhere before and I have travelled in Europe extensively. Nor was this explained to us before making the booking and the booking was made directly with the hotel, not trhough a travel site. A further €160 was then mysteriously blocked 24 hours later for what reason we don't know. This then led to a rather pained and stressed conversation with reception staff as to what was going on. Unless the Ellington improves substantially, I really wouldn't recommend staying here. I think it represented poor value for money and I'm sure there are other hotels in Berlin which are just as convenient and provide a superior standard of service at this rating level.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanted by the Ellington”
Reviews.Author: FionaBell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ellington in early May, just after it opened. Right away you knew it was going to be interesting. The institutional looking architecture opened up to a modern, sophisticated, all-white interior. The staff wore some rather silly 1920s-era costumes, but were friendly and seemed eager to please. The room was also a stark white decor with modern amenities and extremely comfortable beds and pillows. The biggest issue in the room was the proximity of the shower and bathroom to the beds. You walked out of the shower and practically onto the bed. If you were sharing the room it would be difficult to sleep while someone used the facilities. There was also an issue with a terrible deceased rodent smell coming from the shower. Management was notified and attempted to contain a look that indicated maybe it was me that smelled. The breakfast provided by the hotel was excellent. Quite an array of items - omelettes, cereal, meats & cheeses; the coffee was outstanding. The location was great, just a couple blocks from the Ku'damm shopping district and an easy walk to several U-bahn stations. Being new there are some quirks to work out, but it was a beautiful hotel and I would definitely stay at the Ellington again.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel with a lot of class - named after Duke Ellington !”
Reviews.Author: Venezia7
Reviews.Content: We had been very so unfortunate to stay at the Wallstreet Hotel (see my review of this hotel!) and then we were recommended to try the Ellington by the staff at another hotel - they were actually so sweet to make the booking for us. This hotel had at the time only been open for 6 days but everything is working perfectly and the staff is impecably sweet and competent. The whole place is very stylish and the breakfast buffet is a chapter for itself at a price from 6 to 12 euro depending on your appetite!! Try it and you will - as we were - be amazed of the 3 stars - this hotel definitively deserves 4 stars !!

HotelInfo.Name: Ellington Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Nuernberger Strasse 50-55, 10789 Berlin, Germany
